description: Gets information about a specified Resolver rule, such as the domain name that the rule forwards DNS queries for and the ID of the outbound Resolver endpoint that the rule is associated with.

parameters.name: ResolverRuleId
parameters.description: The ID of the Resolver rule that you want to get information about.

nested_items.name: ResolverRule
nested_items.description: Information about the Resolver rule that you specified in a GetResolverRule request.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID that Resolver assigned to the Resolver rule when you created it.

nested_items.name: CreatorRequestId
nested_items.description: A unique string that you specified when you created the Resolver rule. CreatorRequestId identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) for the Resolver rule specified by Id.

nested_items.name: DomainName
nested_items.description: DNS queries for this domain name are forwarded to the IP addresses that are specified in TargetIps. If a query matches multiple Resolver rules (example.com and www.example.com), the query is routed using the Resolver rule that contains the most specific domain name (www.example.com).

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: A code that specifies the current status of the Resolver rule.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: A detailed description of the status of a Resolver rule.

nested_items.name: RuleType
nested_items.description: When you want to forward DNS queries for specified domain name to resolvers on your network, specify FORWARD or DELEGATE. If a query matches multiple Resolver rules (example.com and www.example.com), outbound DNS queries are routed using the Resolver rule that contains the most specific domain name (www.example.com).

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name for the Resolver rule, which you specified when you created the Resolver rule.

nested_items.name: TargetIps
nested_items.description: An array that contains the IP addresses and ports that an outbound endpoint forwards DNS queries to. Typically, these are the IP addresses of DNS resolvers on your network.

nested_items.name: Ip
nested_items.description: One IPv4 address that you want to forward DNS queries to.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port at Ip that you want to forward DNS queries to.

nested_items.name: Ipv6
nested_items.description: One IPv6 address that you want to forward DNS queries to.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocols for the target address. The protocol you choose needs to be supported by the outbound endpoint of the Resolver rule.

nested_items.name: ServerNameIndication
nested_items.description: The Server Name Indication of the DoH server that you want to forward queries to. This is only used if the Protocol of the TargetAddress is DoH.

nested_items.name: ResolverEndpointId
nested_items.description: The ID of the endpoint that the rule is associated with.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: When a rule is shared with another Amazon Web Services account, the account ID of the account that the rule is shared with.

nested_items.name: ShareStatus
nested_items.description: Whether the rule is shared and, if so, whether the current account is sharing the rule with another account, or another account is sharing the rule with the current account.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the Resolver rule was created, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: ModificationTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the Resolver rule was last updated, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: DelegationRecord
nested_items.description: DNS queries with delegation records that point to this domain name are forwarded to resolvers on your network.
